abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the GEF-Ningbo Water
            and Environment Project are to reduce the land-based
            pollution along the Cixi coast and the East China Sea,
            promote the replication of innovative low cost wastewater
            treatment techniques, and encourage coastal zone
            conservation. The extension is necessary to satisfactorily
            complete consultancy support for the Operation and
            Maintenance (O&M) of the wetlands. Under this component,
            the C2 consultant consortium, financed by the GEF grant, has
            provided valuable advice and guidance for the design of
            rehabilitation works for the wetlands. Due to the delayed
            engagement of the C2 consultant consortium and delays in the
            construction schedule, the O&M phase was delayed.
            O&M support by the C2 consultant consortium is just
            beginning, and the project requires their inputs through to
            November 2011, which is when the C2 consultant
            consortium's contract expires. This would require the
            extension of the GEF grant closing date by 1 year to
            December 31, 2011. The borrower has in place an action plan
            acceptable to the Bank to complete the project.
